question: When trees are removed from an area in a tropical rainforest, the area experiences an increase in soil erosion. Which statement best explains why removing the trees can lead to soil erosion?
candidate_answers: (A) Less bedrock will be available to make soil. (B) There will be fewer roots to hold the soil in place. (C) The number of soil-eating insects in the area will increase. (D) The amount of solar radiation reaching the ground will increase.
answer: The amount of solar radiation reaching the ground will increase.
label: D
